question_text: Which of the following are valid characteristics of IPv6 addressing? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: IPv6 uses colons and hexadecimal formatting
IPv6 requires NAT to connect to the internet
IPv6 supports link-local and unique local addressing
IPv6 allows compression of consecutive zeros
correct_answer: IPv6 uses colons and hexadecimal formatting
IPv6 supports link-local and unique local addressing
IPv6 allows compression of consecutive zeros
explanation: IPv6 offers native support for address compression, local addressing types, and does not depend on NAT like IPv4.
